column4: some of you may remember i am making a usb emergency boot stick

however i started over and reformatted to ext4 and now grub tells me to load the kernel first
to boot what I just logged on.
ur on TC?
TC?
tiny core
you meant usb?
I saw that after  posted, so grub2 is not booting TC

ISO loaded
i extracted the zip file and made my own grub.cfg
i sudo installed grub then extracted the iso and made a menu entry for it
you might try the bootscript to look at it
bootscript?
it is for install mainly but it will tell you where the mbr is looking etc.http://bootinfoscript.sourceforge.net/
would do a full install of puppy linux it would be much easier and is grub2
its a 512MB stick space is needed
i know puppy is only 100mb but tc is 10x smaller
